The Minnesota Department of Revenue has two state tax relief programs for families called the Minnesota K‑12 Education Credit and the K-12 Education Subtraction. These benefits can reduce families’ income taxes and increase tax refunds if they save receipts for their children’s qualifying education-related expenses. Most Minnesotans qualify for the K-12 Education Subtraction, which reduces their taxable income.

Learn more about these programs and which education-related expenses qualify here: https://www.revenue.state.mn.us/k-12-education-subtraction-and-credit.

Steve Taggart, our #nfldedu Middle School industrial technology teacher, is using district 3D printers to make face shields for
Northfield Hospital + Clinics and the Northfield Police Department, with the goal of producing 130 by the end of next week. Medical workers and emergency personnel wear the shields as an extra layer of protection from COVID-19 exposure. The shields also protect their N-95 masks from being exposed, so masks last longer.

Northfield Chief of Police Monte Nelson says the shields are a vital piece of PPE for his officers, as he isn't able to purchase face shields due to backorders. Mr. Taggart says he wishes his students could be involved in this project, as it's a great example of how engineering is helping to make the world a better place.

Northfield High School's publication, The Periscope, was first published around 1922. Through the years, The Periscope has evolved as technology has evolved. This year, the Adobe InDesign class has repurposed the publication from a time-sensitive newspaper to an issue-oriented magazine. Guest contributors share their expertise on specific topics students have identified as pertinent, including stress management, gender, emotional health, and interpersonal issues. The Periscope features full-color pages designed and printed in the high-end graphics lab.

The Adobe InDesign class is part of the high school's CTE department, where project-based learning that engages and inspires students is the norm. #nfldedu
